DOC.brief_summary: 100 patients aged 21-40 years old, diagnosed as primary or secondary infertility . These patients are then assigned to receive fertility treatment (ovulation induction, ICSI, intrauterine insemination and IVF). They undergo a 3D vaginal ultrasound before treatment to measure the junctional zone thickness and followed up after treatment to determine the rate of implantation.
DOC.brief_title: 3D Ultrasound Measurement of Junctional Zone Thickness and Its Relation to Implantation Success
DOC.criteria: infertile women congenital uterine anomalies medical disease contraindicating pregnancy
